Package net.nextinfinity.core.arena

Interface ArenaManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoreArenaManager

    public interface ArenaManager
    The ArenaManager object is a management interface for individual Arena objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clearArenas​()
      Unload and delete all arena worlds.
      ArenaEditor createEditor​(java.lang.String name, GamePlayer player)
      Creates an editing session for an arena.
      boolean createSchematic​(GamePlayer player, java.lang.String name)
      Creates a schematic from the player's WorldEdit selection and places the schematic in the game's schematic folder.
      void deleteWorld​(org.bukkit.World world)
      Unloads a World from Bukkit and deletes it from the disk.
      Arena getArena​(java.lang.String name)
      Gets the arena with a certain name.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Arena>> getArenaMap​()
      Gets the map of all active arenas, where the key is the name of the arena and the list is all arenas running for that map.
      ArenaMenu getMenu​()
      Gets the ArenaMenu object
      boolean isArenaWorld​(org.bukkit.World world)
      Check if a World belongs to an Arena.
      void loadArenas​()
      Loads stored data for arenas into memory.
      void removeArena​(Arena arena)
      Removes an Arena object from memory.
      void setArenaClass​(java.lang.Class<? extends Arena> newClass)
      Alters the Java class to be used for arenas, in case a game wishes to use a custom arena class.
      void setLobby​(org.bukkit.Location location)
      Sets the global lobby the location.

    • Method Detail

      • getArena

        Arena getArena​(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the arena with a certain name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the arena to search for
        Returns:
        the Arena object for the arena with the searched name

      • removeArena

        void removeArena​(Arena arena)
        Removes an Arena object from memory.
        Parameters:
        arena - the arena to remove

      • loadArenas

        void loadArenas​()
        Loads stored data for arenas into memory. This should usually only be called during game initialization.

      • clearArenas

        void clearArenas​()
        Unload and delete all arena worlds.

      • createEditor

        ArenaEditor createEditor​(java.lang.String name,
                         GamePlayer player)
        Creates an editing session for an arena.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the arena to create the edit session for
        player - the entity to apply the editing session to
        Returns:
        the created ArenaEditor object
        See Also:
        ArenaEditor

      • getMenu

        ArenaMenu getMenu​()
        Gets the ArenaMenu object
        Returns:
        the ArenaMenu object

      • createSchematic

        boolean createSchematic​(GamePlayer player,
                        java.lang.String name)
        Creates a schematic from the player's WorldEdit selection and places the schematic in the game's schematic folder.
        Parameters:
        player - the GamePlayer to whose Player is associated with the selection
        name - the name of the schematic
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • setLobby

        void setLobby​(org.bukkit.Location location)
        Sets the global lobby the location.
        Parameters:
        location - the new lobby location

      • getArenaMap

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Arena>> getArenaMap​()
        Gets the map of all active arenas, where the key is the name of the arena and the list is all arenas running for that map.
        Returns:
        the Map of all active arenas

      • setArenaClass

        void setArenaClass​(java.lang.Class<? extends Arena> newClass)
        Alters the Java class to be used for arenas, in case a game wishes to use a custom arena class. The new class must implement Arena. It may be helpful for custom arena classes to extend CoreArena, as this implements all necessary functions.
        Parameters:
        newClass - the new Java class to use for arenas
        See Also:
        CoreArena

      • isArenaWorld

        boolean isArenaWorld​(org.bukkit.World world)
        Check if a World belongs to an Arena.
        Parameters:
        world - the world to check
        Returns:
        true if the World belongs to an Arena, false otherwise

      • deleteWorld

        void deleteWorld​(org.bukkit.World world)
        Unloads a World from Bukkit and deletes it from the disk.
        Parameters:
        world - the World to delete
